title: Contesting exclusion in a multi-ethnic state: rethinking ethnic nationalism in Nigeria

key_findings.conclusion: Ethnic nationalism has increasingly won support in Nigeria over the last five decades.
key_findings.evidence: The deepest attachment has been that of ethnic and regional consciousness, exacerbated by political and economic exclusion.

key_findings.conclusion: Nigeria is characterised by intractable conflicts and instability due to its history of a complex web of identities.
key_findings.evidence: The major issues generating fears of exclusion include the control of state power, resource allocation, and citizenship, leading to violent conflicts.

applicable_situations.situation: Societal conflicts arising from ethnic nationalism
applicable_situations.advice: Addressing issues related to state power, resource allocation, and citizenship can help mitigate conflicts and promote inclusivity.

applicable_situations.situation: National identity formation in multi-ethnic states
applicable_situations.advice: Promoting a common citizenry with shared aspirations and a cosmopolitan outlook can help overcome ethnic loyalty and foster unity.
